wikipedia_page.main: Harry Adams (1855 – 13 July 1910) was an England-born Welsh footballer who played as a goalkeeper for Druids during their FA Cup run in 1882–83 and made four international appearances for Wales.

response: * Harry Adams (1855–1910) Welsh international footballer,   Harry Adams, EU Football Info retrieved 11 March 2018 moved to Ellesmere 1883, then plumber in Watergate Street
* Harry Adams (basketball), head basketball coach at DePaul University, 1924–1925
* Harry Adams (sport shooter) (1880–1960), American Olympic sport shooter
* Harry Adams (footballer) (1855–1910), Druids F.C. and Wales international footballer
* Harry Adams (baseball umpire) (1863–1941), Major League Baseball umpire
* Harry Adams (cricket umpire) (1881–1946), South African cricket umpire
